name: app-basic
description: Shows how to build a basic app plugin that uses custom routing

name: app-with-backend
description: Shows how to build an app plugin with its own backend

name: app-with-dashboards
description: Shows how to include pre-built dashboards in an app plugin

name: app-with-extension-point
description: Shows how to add a plugin extension point that can be extended by other plugins.

name: app-with-extensions
description: Shows how to build an app plugin that extends the Grafana core UI

name: app-with-rbac
description: A basic app plugin with role-based access control (RBAC).

name: app-with-scenes
description: Shows how to build a basic app with @grafana/scenes

name: app-with-service-account
description: Shows how an app can request a service account to query the Grafana API.

name: datasource-basic
description: Shows how to build a basic data source plugin.

name: datasource-http-backend
description: Shows how to query data from HTTP-based APIs, where the HTTP calls happens on the backend. Supports alerting.

name: datasource-http
description: Shows how to query data from HTTP-based APIs. The HTTP call happens on the frontend.

name: datasource-logs
description: Shows how to support logging in a data source plugin.

name: datasource-streaming-backend-websocket
description: Shows how to create an event-based data source plugin using backend streams.

name: datasource-streaming-websocket
description: Shows how to create an event-based data source plugin using RxJS and WebSockets.

name: panel-basic
description: Shows how to build a panel plugin that uses the time series graph to read and update time range.

name: panel-datalinks
description: Shows how to build a panel plugin that uses the datalinks functionality of Grafana.

name: panel-frame-select
description: Shows how to update panel options with values from a data query response.
